name: Outrigger Little Hastings Street Resort & Spa Noosa

reviews.text: We stayed in a very spacious and beautifully appointed 2 bedroom apartment. I couldn't fault the apartment at all with two large bedrooms both with en-suite bathrooms, a laundry room and a good size kitchen/living room with sliding glass wall leading onto a large balcony.
reviews.title: Excellent resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several pools which are nicely designed and very clean although sadly the weather wasn't on our side and so we didn't get to use them as much as we'd like.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: The only real issue (for some people) would be that the resort is a 5 to 10 minute walk from Hastings Street and the beach. There is a free golf buggy shuttle at certain times through the day and the walk isn't beyond the means of anyone reasonably fit and mobile.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The only down-side is that this is a modern apartment resort and is perhaps architecturally not beautiful although it is interesting. It perhaps feels somewhat clinical.
reviews.title: Absolutely awful
Great place
reviews.text: Other than that I'd say the staff we met were all exceptionally hospitable, warm and helpful.

reviews.title: A bit of walk
reviews.text: Our family spent 3 days in Noosa Heads and stayed at the hotel. Overall we were happy with our choice. Nice breakfast and well serviced apartment but I thought a few feedback is always welcomed:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Location: the hotel is within walking distance from Hasting Street. Takes about 10-15 minutes if walking with pram. The hotel complex located on uphill, so it was bit tiring walking back after finishing a day's activities. The buggy service is only available for limited time slot. Would be great if it runs throughout the day.
reviews.title: Nice Noosa Nest....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Cleanness: our room was general clean but I think the floors and stairs in common area on each floor need thoughtful clean very soon. It was filthy and dirty in my opinion.
reviews.title: So disappointing! Expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Restaurant: we ordered two meals from the hotel restaurant and had it delivered to our room, but the food was rather disappointing.
reviews.title: faultless, great value, excellent location

reviews.text: While it is a little way off the beaten path, this is a nice condo type accommodation. The room had all the amenities and a washer dryer which is nice on longer trips. It was very comfortable. There are limited restaurant options on site so a walk to town is necessary. The walk to Hastings Street was easy and to 7-10 minutes. The walk back took a little longer as it is uphill after dinner.... There is a golf cart to provide transportation for those who request it.
reviews.title: Good bits.... And bad bits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights and found the apartment for four very comfortable and well appointed. The breakfasts were really good, we did not eat at night but the menu was tempting. The walk down to Hastings Street was good exercise even on the walk back after a few glasses of the red stuff.
reviews.title: Good apartment helpful staff
Nice spot
reviews.text: The staff were really great and appeared that they really cared. If you stay do NOT use the recommended WI FI connection if you want to end up with any hair!! We had nothing but hassle and poor connections and when you called the company the customer service was very poor-"it must be something you are doing!!" Hope the hotel can make changes here as when and if I return I would not want that kind of problem again !!
The walk up to the scenic point is really worth doing-don't do it in the real heat of the day-the pool is great when not overrun with kids-and before you say it they need their space too but.........
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week with my husband and 5 month old and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was good, just up the hill from Hastings St. We made regular use of the buggy services (special thanks to Tyler for being such a congenial young man, Owen too) and found it very convenient. Our 1 bedroom suite had a lovely NP view. The kitchen was well appointed and the bed and bath comfortable. For the price I would have liked a little more so space but it was sufficient. The spa was lovely, as was the breakfast (though the buffet quite pricey when it's not included in your package). We would have had more room service if the menu was more extensive as our small child meant dining out wasn't an option. The main pool was very nice though I was surprised by its small size. Would be great if the bar/ kiosk was open earlier in the day. All in all a very nice place to visit and we would stay again.
reviews.title: Kind of souless

reviews.text: I recently stayed in Noosa for 2 nights and had booked Outrigger. You get all the benefits of a hotel - breakfast is provided, 2 swimming pools, complimentary buggy service down the drive and helpful concierges but also the privacy of an apartment with a balcony and a kitchen if you want to self cater. Perfectly located for the shops and restaurants on Hastings Street and the beach but secluded enough as well. Good location for the Emundi Markets and could happily have spent a week there. I would definately come back and book other Outrigger venues on the basis of this one.
reviews.title: Pleasant Resort Location In Noosa

reviews.text: Well positioned units (serviced apartments) within the national park. It is only a 5-10minute walk down to town and 10-12 minutes back. The climb back is well graded and a relatively easy walk.
reviews.title: Nice units but not a resort and certainly not 5 star.
Sensational stay...
reviews.text: We had a very nice view over the roves of several other blocks to the sea. A bush and water view. Really very nice.

There is no resort pool. Despite the complex having a pool and a lap pool, these cannot be considered resort style. At best the pool is a very large backyard pool. Well below what us expected if a resort and the room rates charged. There maybe 24 lounges but this is an absolute fraction of the population of the development if even only partly occupied.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice but there is not a desk and internet access is expensive.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: Practical kitchenette, two burner gas burners, microwave/grill oven, half size fridge, dishwasher, sink. Well equipped. Ironing board and iron. Washing machine and dryer.
reviews.title: Near the action but quiet oasis

aka: Outrigger Little Hastings Street Resort And Spa Noosa
description: Occupying a prime location off Hastings Street and bordering the spectacular Noosa National Park, this village style resort features resort pool and bar, day spa and lap pool, restaurant, gym and games room. Due to council regulations the resort has two entrances. Day Entrance: 7am to 7pm - Via Viewland Drive (33a Viewland Drive on your GPS)Evening Entrance: 7pm to 7am - Via Hastings Street and Morwong Drive (5 Morwong Drive in your GPS).
